messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] String, was Re: vegetarianism
messages.msgSnippet: My son Julian put a lego pulley from my antique governor Winthrop desk across the way to the fireplace and I walked into it. The result? I pulled the desktop
messages.messageBody:
My son Julian put a lego pulley from my antique governor Winthrop desk across the way to the fireplace and I walked into it. The result? I pulled the desktop completely off the desk! Pretty powerful string.
Johanna
----- Original Message -----
From: DiamondAir
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Friday, April 06, 2001 1:29 AM
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] String, was Re: vegetarianism

>    From: "LisaBugg" <LisaBugg@...>
> I'd love to go back to string. My boys discovered Fishing Line! After they
> saw the movie with Sean Connery, the one where he's an art thief, I had
> *laser lines* everywhere!


Ahhh, that reminds me of a really unfortunate incident in my college years
when I had to construct something for an art class and used "invisible
string". Well, the roll got away from me in my dorm room and cause untold
torment for weeks! We couldn't get rid of the darned stuff and were
continually tripping on it.

After getting closelined on the stairs at night last week by some black
string, and almost broke my neck (thank heavens I wasn't carrying the
baby!), I've had to make a "not across any pathway" rule for the string
around here...

Blue Skies!
   -Robin-
Mom to Mackenzie (8/28/96) "My pants are outgrowing me"
and Asa (10/5/99) "Potty pee! Potty pee! Potty pee!"
http://www.geocities.com/the_clevengers   Flying Clevenger Family

messages.msgSnippet: My son is a spiderman type of guy, and your post sounds familiar! Intricate webs through out the house with  thread and floss LOL Tami ...
messages.messageBody:
My son is a spiderman type of guy, and your post sounds familiar!
Intricate webs through out the house with thread and floss LOL
Tami
